verses.roman:
bhagavaṁs takṣakādibhyo
mṛtyubhyo na bibhemy aham
praviṣṭo brahma nirvāṇam
abhayaṁ darśitaṁ tvayā

synonyms: bhagavan—my lord; takṣaka—from the snake-bird Takṣaka; ādibhyaḥ—or other living entities; mṛtyubhyaḥ—from repeated deaths; na bibhemi—do not fear; aham—I; praviṣṭaḥ—having entered; brahma—the Absolute Truth; nirvāṇam—exclusive of everything material; abhayam—fearlessness; darśitam—shown; tvayā—by you.
translation: My lord, I now have no fear of Takṣaka or any other living being, or even of repeated deaths, because I have absorbed myself in that purely spiritual Absolute Truth, which you have revealed and which destroys all fear.
